intro: Canthium benthamianum, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. The flowers are small and clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
